results.headline: Teenagers, Fed Up, Hatch a Deadly Plan
results.summary_short: In “Perfect Sisters,” based on a true story, two Canadian siblings decide to kill their mother.

results.headline: Art and Style Are Their Lifeblood
results.summary_short: In “Only Lovers Left Alive,” Jim Jarmusch’s celebration of art and style, cultured vampires make up a kind of aesthetic aristocracy.

results.headline: Kitchen Table Anarchists Under Siege
results.summary_short: “No God, No Master,” starring David Strathairn, offers a sepia-toned account of the Palmer raids, a time of reds-under-the-bed hysteria and leftist persecution.

results.headline: Writing a Playbook That Ensures Glory
results.summary_short: Kevin Costner plays the beleaguered general manager of the Cleveland Browns in “Draft Day.”

results.headline: On the Wall, Who’s the Deadliest One of All?
results.summary_short: Karen Gillan and Brenton Thwaites play siblings seeking clues to their parents’ fate in a tale alternating between time periods.

results.headline: Wooing the Boss With a Spicy Dance
results.summary_short: In “Cuban Fury,” the British comic Nick Frost stars as a former child salsa-dancing champ who brushes up on his skills to woo his new American boss.

results.headline: Exploring the Blot on a Newspaper’s Record
results.summary_short: Samantha Grant’s documentary, “A Fragile Trust,” comes a decade after the fraud scandal at The New York Times perpetrated by the reporter Jayson Blair.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Fragile Trust

results.headline: Don’t Hoodwink the Help, Dear
results.summary_short: “Hateship Loveship” tells of a new housekeeper for a disturbed Iowa family and the damage that ensues when a prank is played on her.

results.headline: On-Camera Dating
results.summary_short: “Hank and Asha” is the story of an epistolary, long-distance romance that uses video recordings instead of pen and paper.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hank and Asha

results.headline: Latin Rhythms, Exported to the Mideast
results.summary_short: In “Dancing in Jaffa,” the ballroom dancer Pierre Dulaine, whose organization was featured in “Mad Hot Ballroom,” teaches Jewish and Palestinian youngsters steps and courtesies.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dancing in Jaffa

results.headline: That Bend in the River Might be Manufactured
results.summary_short: “Watermark” explores how water shapes us, and how we shape water, as the filmmakers travel across 10 countries.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Watermark

results.headline: A Much Darker Hitchhiker’s Guide
results.summary_short: In “Under the Skin,” Scarlett Johansson is an extraterrestrial femme fatale picking up, and disposing of, unsuspecting men in Glasgow.

results.headline: Oh, C’mon, You Make Pale Blond Girls Feel Tan
results.summary_short: In “Being Ginger,” a man searches for a woman who will like him for the carrot top he is.

results.headline: Hard Times Take Their Toll on a Singapore Family
results.summary_short: “Ilo Ilo,” Anthony Chen’s first feature film, focuses on a middle-class family in Singapore facing uncertainty in a 1997 financial crisis.

results.headline: An Island Idyll Turns Sinister
results.summary_short: When honeymooners in the Caribbean wind up entangled in a violent underworld, the actress Gina Carano puts her mixed-martial-arts skills to use.

results.headline: After the Indulgence of Young Lust, the Going Gets Tougher (and Rougher)
results.summary_short: “Nymphomaniac: Volume II,” the second half of Lars von Trier’s tale of an aging sex addict, examines the risky fallout of her obsession.

results.headline: Courage, Loyalty, Honor, Kablooey
results.summary_short: Producers describe “Captain America: The Winter Soldier,” a sequel in the comic-book-based franchise, as a blend of action film and political thriller.

results.headline: Futzing and Flirting as Armageddon Unfolds
results.summary_short: In “Goodbye World,” a violent breakdown in society prompts friends to reunite at the home of a couple who live off the grid.

results.headline: Seeking Eden, They Fled to Far Isle; Hell Followed
results.summary_short: In the late 1920s and early ’30s, couples (and a threesome) moved to an uninhabited island in the Galápagos chain, a tale told in a new historical documentary.

results.headline: Halle Berry as a Woman of Many Faces
